moves.2... Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4 b5 5. Bb3: Pressure on f7 I like this position
moves.5... Nf6 6. Ng5 d5: His pawn move stopped my fork
moves.7. Nc3 Qe7 8. a3 h6 9. Nf3: So ok moves puts pressure on his d5 panw
moves.9... Ng4 10. Bxd5 Qc5: I believe he made a mistake. But he ends up in a mate threat
moves.11. Qe2 Nd4: Now I can take the rook
moves.23... Qb7 24. b4 Nh7 25. Rfd1 Qe7 26. Rd: With my lead I lose focus in the game and look what happens later
moves.28. Nd5 Bxd5 29. exd5 Nf6 30. Qxe5 Nh5 3: This is when I should of saw mate and moved queen to g4
moves.34. Qd7 Qxg2#: Even thought I lost this game taught me not to rule out a player as this can happen. Hope you learned a lesson reading this as now before I move I take few minutes to size up the board
